sen.j: 細川 氏春（ほそかわ うじはる）は、南北朝時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Ujiharu HOSOKAWA was a Japanese military commander in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.
Ujiharu HOSOKAWA was a military commander in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: 原文の通りにしました。

sen.j: 細川氏の淡路国守護家の一族である。
sen.e: He belonged to the family of Awaji no kuni Shugo (the provincial constable of Awaji Province) in the Hosokawa clan.

sen.j: 細川師氏の子として生まれる。
sen.e: Ujiharu was born as a son of Morouji HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 貞和4年/正平 (日本)3年（1348年）に父が死去したため、家督を継いで淡路守護となった。
sen.e: In 1348, Ujiharu inherited the family estate and became Awaji shugo after the death of his father.

sen.j: 康安元年/正平16年（1361年）に細川清氏が佐々木道誉らに讒言されて将軍・足利義詮によって追討令が出されたために清氏が南朝 (日本)に降伏すると、それに従って南朝に降伏する。
sen.e: In 1361, Shogun (the great general) Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA issued an order to track down and kill Kiyouji HOSOKAWA by the false charge of Doyo SASAKI, etc., and after Kiyouji surrendered to the Nancho (old South Court), Ujiharu also surrendered to the Nancho followed him.

sen.j: そして同年末には清氏と共に北朝 (日本)方を破って京都を占領するに至った。
sen.e: And in the end of 1361, Ujiharu defeated the Hokucho (old Northern Court) together with Kiyouji and occupied Kyoto City.

sen.j: その後、幕府の巻き返しにあって敗北し、貞治元年/正平17年（1362年）に清氏と共に讃岐国に渡海して再挙を図ったが、ここで幕命を受けた細川頼之に攻撃されて清氏は戦死し、氏春は降伏して幕府に帰順し、淡路守護に再任された。
sen.e: Later, Ujiharu was defeated by backlash of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), and moved to Sanuki province by boat with Kiyouji to attempt to raise an army again in 1362, but Kiyouji was killed in battle attacked by Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA who was ordered by the bakufu, and therefore, Ujiharu surrendered and returned to allegiance to the bakufu, and was appointed to Awaji shugo again.

sen.j: その後は幕府方の武将として応安6年/文中2年（1373年）には河内国で南朝勢力と戦い、武功を挙げた。
sen.e: After that, Ujiharu fought with the Nancho power in Kawachi province and was successful in military exploits as a military commander standing for the bakufu in 1373.

sen.j: 淡路守護家は子の満春が継ぎ、代々細川氏の有力な分家の一つとして存続したが、戦国時代 (日本)初期の細川尚春の時代に三好氏滅ぼされ断絶した。
sen.e: Mitsuharu, Ujiharu's son, inherited the shugo family of Awaji province and the family continued for generations as one of powerful branch families of the Hosokawa clan, but was destroyed by the Miyoshi clan in the rein of Hisaharu HOSOKAWA at the beginning of the Sengoku period (the period of warring states) and the family line ended.
